column4: Is there anyway to completely disable pulseaudio and switch back to primarily using alsa?
I have a link to troubleshooting pulseaudio from the forums, do you want to take a look?
no
I want to disable it
not troubleshoot it
linus should have gotten on the whole audio problem before OSS/ALSA matured
I know there's got to be many others who hate pulseaudio as much as me
I believe you can just select alsa everything
Where? In Ksolitaire?
sure try that, let me know how it goes
you gave a poor answer
I was pointing that out
not that I don't appreciate any help given
just "Select <x>" when you don't specify _where_ is pretty useless
you seem to know enough about how certain things get integrated into a release, surley you can figure out how to kill pulseaudio?
Yes, I'm more than aware of how to kill it, in fact, I'm even more aware that it's silently crashing/stopping. Unfortunately everything seems to want to still use pulseaudio
I'm asking how to completely bypass pulseaudio
as just killing it doesn't magically make alsa work again
I think I got it
thanks exodus_ms, and kitche
http://paste.ubuntu.com/110107/
now that is wonderful, thanks a bunch exodus_ms

on second thought, this isn't really removing it at all, simply doing sudo apt-get remove pulseaudio; apt-get install esound seemed to do the trick, oh and removing pulseaudio references from rc levels
